content.question:
<math alttext="Brown 2 N O 2 gas is in equilibrium with Colorless N 2 O 4 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><mtext>Brown</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><mtext> </mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mo>⇄</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace></mtd></mtr></mtable><mtable><mtr><mtd><mtext>Colorlesss</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
A sample of pure <math alttext="N O 2 gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in a sealed tube at <math alttext="20 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is placed in a temperature bath at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Observations of changes in the color, pressure, and mass of the mixture are recorded as a function of time. Which of the following is an observation that would best support the claim that the reaction represented above has reached equilibrium at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The total mass of the system remains constant because the amounts of reactant and product do not change with time at equilibrium.
The color of the system changes from brown to completely colorless because only the product will be present at equilibrium.
The total pressure of the system decreases then reaches a constant value because the amounts of reactant and product no longer change at equilibrium.
The temperature of the system remains constant because the temperature must be constant at equilibrium.

content.answer: The total pressure of the system decreases then reaches a constant value because the amounts of reactant and product no longer change at equilibrium.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
